title._content: S.T. Pritchett -- R.L. Etheridge -- Oscar Perkins  (LOC)

description._content: Bain News Service,, publisher. S.T. Pritchett -- R.L. Etheridge -- Oscar Perkins [between ca. 1914 and ca. 1915] 1 negative : glass ; 5 x 7 in. or smaller. Notes: Title from data provided by the Bain News Service on the negative. Photo shows crew members of the steamship Monroe which was hit by the Nantucket off the shore of Virginia in January 1914. Assistant engineer Oscar Perkins and wireless operator Robert Lee Etheridge testified at the government inquiry into the crash on February 18, 1914. (Source: Flickr Commons project, 2010 and New York Times, Jan. 31, 1914 and Feb. 18, 1914) Forms part of: George Grantham Bain Collection (Library of Congress). Format: Glass negatives. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print General information about the Bain Collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.ggbain Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.15488 Call Number: LC-B2- 2993-1
